body:
Hi Belal,


actually evalglare uses only 6 colors and distributes them according to 
the occurrence, which means somehow random and the same color can appear 
several times, although it is a different glare source. If the peak 
extraction happens (above 50000cd, you probably have a second glare 
source totally surrounded by another one).


In fact the coloring is meant to be just a testing-function to see if 
the glare sources are detected correctly or if the detecting parameters 
have to be adapted.


You can identify the center of each glare source by the x any y 
coordinates (column 3 and 4 of the output).


Jan
___
<sup>Automatically generated content from [radiance mailing-list](https://radiance-online.org/pipermail/hdri/2017-December/000684.html).</sup>
